definitions.definition: (with the verb "to be") Present in the vicinity.

definitions.example: "How is old Bob? I heard that his health is failing."  "Oh, he's still around. He's feeling better now."

definitions.definition: So as to form a circle or trace a circular path, or approximation thereof.
So as to surround or be near.

definitions.example: An adult elephant weighs around five tons.
Look around and see what you find.

definitions.definition: From one state or condition to an opposite or very different one; with a metaphorical change in direction; bringing about awareness or agreement.
definitions.example: He used to stay up late but his new girlfriend changed that around.

definitions.definition: (with turn, spin etc.) So as to partially or completely rotate; so as to face in the opposite direction.
definitions.example: She spun around a few times.

definitions.definition: Used with verbs to indicate repeated or continuous action, or in numerous locations or with numerous people.
definitions.example: I asked around, and no-one really liked it.

definitions.definition: Used with certain verbs to suggest unproductive activity.
Defining a circle or closed curve containing a thing.
definitions.example: I planted a row of lilies around the statue.
There has been a lot of controversy around the handling of personal information.

definitions.definition: Following the perimeter of a specified area and returning to the starting point.
definitions.example: She went around the track fifty times.

definitions.definition: Following a path which curves near an object, with the object on the inside of the curve.
definitions.example: The road took a brief detour around the large rock formation, then went straight on.
I don't want you around me.

definitions.definition: At or to various places within.
definitions.example: She went around the office and got everyone to sign the card.
